repos_url.description: RadioDNS and RadioVIS Slideshow Protocol Demo

repos_url.description: Fun with Quartz Composer on Snow Leopard and the BBC Radio Schedule

repos_url.description: Twitter Zeitgeist

repos_url.description: A Google Chrome extension that displays BBC Now Next information. Blog Post: [http://littl.me/p1ew]

repos_url.description: A simple demo of Publish/Subscribe in the browser using Strophe.js

repos_url.name: REST-API-example
repos_url.description: Simple REST API example in Sinatra

repos_url.name: AudioSyncClientDemo
repos_url.description: A browser-based AudioSync client. It can tell you what radio station you're tuned to just by listening to it.

repos_url.name: UCMythTV
repos_url.description: A full implementation of Universal Control 0.6.0 for use on a computer running Mythbuntu with a slightly modified version of MythTV (patches and configure script included).

repos_url.description: Solr Ruby

repos_url.description: This Ruby Gem provides utilities for working with RadioDNS.

repos_url.name: Similarity
repos_url.description: Calculate similarity between documents using TF-IDF weights

repos_url.name: bbc_service_map
repos_url.description: Map between the multiplicity of BBC service identifiers for TV and radio

repos_url.name: radiotag-tagserver
repos_url.description: Reference implementation of RadioTAG protocol version 1.00

repos_url.name: radiotag-authserver
repos_url.description: An authorization server for BBC R&D's RadioTAG reference implementation (radiotag-tagserver)

repos_url.name: radiotag-radio
repos_url.description: Example implementation of RadioTAG client

repos_url.name: radiotag-models
repos_url.description: DataMapper models for the RadioTAG suite of applications

repos_url.description: A Ruby Gem that tries to resolves urls to the canonical version

repos_url.name: CBuffer
repos_url.description: A simple Ruby implementation of a Circular Buffer

repos_url.description: A Sinatra application that will generate QRCodes for a BBC url with a BBC logo embedded in it.

repos_url.name: radiotag-web
repos_url.description: Demonstration web front end for RadioTAG

repos_url.name: viewtext-ruby
repos_url.description: Ruby wrapper for the Viewtext API

repos_url.name: redux-client-ruby
repos_url.description: Ruby client for BBC Redux

repos_url.name: rdfsim
repos_url.description: Large RDF hierarchies as vector spaces

repos_url.name: stomp
repos_url.description: A ruby gem for sending and receiving messages from a Stomp protocol compliant message queue. Includes: failover logic, ssl support. This version includes changes made by BBC R&D to support our RadioVIS prototype.

repos_url.name: HTML5-MediaElement-startOffsetTime
repos_url.description: Patches to implement startOffsetTime attribute for HTML5 video using WebM

repos_url.name: automated-audio-tagging-evaluation
repos_url.description: Evaluation dataset and script for automated DBpedia tagging of speech audio

repos_url.name: radiotag-doc
repos_url.description: Documentation on the RadioDNS RadioTAG specification

pull_request.title: check most read list has hrefs
pull_request.body:
On Kyrgyz, most read was showing with the container and the numerals, but had all the actual links missing. This tests that the links are present.

(Kyrgyz was disabled until a fix for Optimo articles appearing in most read breaking it)

---

- [x] I have assigned myself to this PR and the corresponding issues
- [x] I have added the `cross-team` label to this PR if it requires visibility across World Service teams
- [x] I have assigned this PR to the Simorgh project
- [x] (BBC contributors only) This PR follows the [repository use guidelines](https://github.com/bbc/simorgh-infrastructure/blob/latest/documentation/repository-guidelines.md)

**Testing:**
Passes on test and live
